questions.question_text: What is the advantage of using dynamic application security testing (DAST) over static application security testing (SAST) methodology?

choices.A: Unlike SAST, DAST is a blackbox and programming language agnostic.
choices.B: DAST can dynamically integrate with most CI/CD tools.
choices.C: DAST delivers more false positives than SAST.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Unlike SAST, DAST is a blackbox and programming language agnostic.

The primary advantage of using Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST) over Static Application Security Testing (SAST) is that DAST is a blackbox testing method and is programming language agnostic. This means DAST tests the application from the outside in, simulating how an attacker would interact with the application without needing access to the source code. It can be used to test any application regardless of the programming language or technology stack used.

Rather than scanning code or binaries like SAST, DAST dynamically crawls through an application interface, testing how it reacts to various inputs.
The good news is they tend to have low rates of false positives.
DAST may require some time to fully scan code.

Selected Answer: D
CCAK P# 355 - dynamic application security testing (DAST) dynamically crawls through an application’s interface, testing how it reacts to various inputs. DAST scanners cannot see what’s going on behind the scenes, but they offer valuable insight into how code behaves, and they can flush out errors other tests may not see in dynamic code paths
DAST is LOW rate false positives, p 355

It should be C because:
A. Unlike SAST, DAST is a blackbox and programming language agnostic. - False. DAST is not programming language
B. DAST can dynamically integrate with most CI/CD tools.. - False. SAST can be integrated.
C. DAST delivers more false positives than SAST. Tue. DAST tends to generate more false positives than SAST.
D. DAST is slower but thorough. False. Both can be slow.

A is correct: https://www.invicti.com/blog/web-security/dast-vs-sast-fact-check-on-static-and-dynamic-application-security-testing/

...[D]ynamic application security testing (DAST) is a black-box testing methodology where a running application is tested from the outside. A DAST tool crawls the application and probes it for runtime vulnerabilities just like an attacker would. On the other hand, static application security testing (SAST) is a white-box security testing method that inspects the application source code to identify potential security vulnerabilities.
...

SAST works on the application source code, so you need to have that code along with tools that support a specific programming language and web application framework.

Selected Answer: D
Agree D.

Selected Answer: D
Should be D.
Rather than scanning code or binaries like SAST, dynamic application security testing (DAST) dynamically crawls through an application’s interface, testing how it reacts to various inputs. DAST scanners cannot see what’s going on behind the scenes, but they offer valuable insight into how code behaves, and they can flush out errors other tests
may not see in dynamic code paths. The good news is they tend to have low rates of false positives. These tests are typically run against fully-built applications and they can be destructive, so the tools often include settings to vary between test and production environments. Like SAST, DAST may require some time to fully scan code, so in-line
tests that gate a release are often run against new code only, and full application sweeps are run in parallel.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a direct benefit of mapping the Cloud Control Matrix (CCM) to other international standards and regulations?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. CCM mapping enables cloud service providers and customers alike to streamline their own compliance and security efforts.

Mapping the Cloud Control Matrix (CCM) to other international standards and regulations helps align various compliance and security requirements, making it easier for both cloud service providers and customers to manage their compliance obligations efficiently.

choices.C: CCM mapping enables an uninterrupted data flow and, in particular, the export of personal data across different jurisdictions.
choices.A: CCM mapping entitles cloud service providers to be listed as an approved supplier for tenders and government contracts.
choices.D: CCM mapping entitles cloud service providers to be certified under the CSA STAR program.
choices.B: CCM mapping enables cloud service providers and customers alike to streamline their own compliance and security efforts.

discussion.content:
Answer B
p. 117, CCAK Study Guide - 
"Establishing a comprehensive cloud policy is very important to organizations that are planning to make major investments in cloud technologies and platforms. When creating policies, the should take the following considerations into account:
• Criteria for limiting services that may be moved to the cloud (e.g., only noncritical services or services that require high availability and resilience)"

Selected Answer: B
B. cloud policy.

The criteria for limiting services, especially regarding which non-critical services or services requiring high availability and resilience can be moved to the cloud, should primarily be included in the cloud policy. The cloud policy serves as the guiding document that outlines the organization's approach, principles, and specific criteria related to the use of cloud services. It addresses considerations such as risk, availability, resilience, and which types of services are appropriate for cloud deployment, ensuring that cloud adoption aligns with the organization's overall strategy and risk tolerance.
B.
B should be correct

choices.D: information security standard for cloud technologies.

questions.question_text: The criteria for limiting services allowing non-critical services or services requiring high availability and resilience to be moved to the cloud is an important consideration to be included PRIMARILY in the:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Stakeholder identification

The first step to establish a cloud assurance program during a cloud migration should be stakeholder identification. Identifying the key stakeholders ensures that all relevant parties are involved from the beginning, including those who will be affected by or responsible for the cloud migration. This step helps in understanding the requirements, expectations, and concerns of different stakeholders, which is essential for the successful planning, design, and implementation of the cloud assurance program. Engaging stakeholders early sets a solid foundation for subsequent steps such as risk assessment, design, and development.

Selected Answer: B
B. Stakeholder identification

The first step in establishing a cloud assurance program during a cloud migration is to identify stakeholders. This step is crucial because it helps to gather input from all relevant parties, including IT, security, compliance, legal, and business units. Engaging stakeholders early ensures that their requirements, expectations, and risk tolerances are integrated into the program from the beginning, providing a strong foundation for subsequent design, risk assessment, and development phases.

The other steps follow stakeholder identification:

A. Design can only be effectively performed after identifying key stakeholders and gathering their input.
C. Development comes after establishing the program's design and requirements.
D. Risk assessment is critical but requires stakeholder input to understand all relevant risks.

Selected Answer: A
This is terribly misleading. Question asks for Step, not Phase. per Study guide the first PHASE is Design, the first 'item' (Step is not mentioned) in design is "Roles & Responsibilities" which implies Stakeholder identification. I would still go with A: Design
Design implies stakeholder identification, correct is A
A. First phase of Cloud assurance Program Development

Selected Answer: B
The answer to the question is B. Stakeholder identification should be the FIRST step to establish a cloud assurance program during a cloud migration. This information can be found on page 36 of the Certificate of Cloud Auditing Knowledge Study Guide.

"Identify roles and responsibilities among the relevant stakeholders, including the oversight role (responsible for success of the assurance program) and the program operations role (responsible for the daily operations of the program)." 

This implies that stakeholder identification is the first step in establishing a cloud assurance program during a cloud migration.

Selected Answer: A
should be A, there is no point in developing if you dont design it first
Should be A

Selected Answer: A
Should be A. Page 35 of the CCAK Study guide.

questions.question_text: Which of the following should be the FIRST step to establish a cloud assurance program during a cloud migration?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. customer’s computing and data compromise.

If the customer management interface is compromised over the public internet, it can lead to the compromise of the customer's computing resources and data. Attackers gaining access to this interface can potentially control customer accounts, manipulate data, and exploit computing resources, leading to significant security breaches and data loss.

New Inherent Risk Factors
Interface compromise: Public cloud providers enable their customer management interfaces to be accessed over the public Internet. If those interfaces are compromised by unauthorized external parties, the cloud customers’ computing and data can also be compromised easily, through capabilities such as remote access and change of cloud security policies.

choices.C: ease of acquisition of cloud services.
choices.B: access to the RAM of neighboring cloud computer.

questions.question_text: Customer management interface, if compromised over public internet, can lead to:
